headline: Black Beans and Rice
description: Black beans and rice flavored with garlic, cumin, and cayenne pepper makes a wholesome, budget-friendly, vegetarian meal or tasty side dish.

video.description: See how to make easy seasoned black beans with white rice.
video.name: Black Beans and Rice

name: Black Beans and Rice
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups low sodium, low fat vegetable broth

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion has softened, about 4 minutes. Stir in rice to coat; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce to a simmer, and cook until liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
Stir in beans, cumin, and cayenne; cook until beans are warmed through.

review.reviewBody: Missing critical factors like seasoning. I sauteed finely chopped celery and carrots as well. Used chicken broth for extra flavour. Otherwise it's just a bland tasteless thing.

Recipe is great the way it is. I love all the people that leave a bad review and put what they add to it. This is a great base recipe as is… yes there’s a ton of directions you can go and plenty of things you can do from there. This is a very useful recipe. Thank you.
I added ground chorizo. It was really good. I didn’t use cayenne, but didn’t have to with the chorizo. It gave it a nice kick. I also used brown rice instead of white.
Super easy and tasty.
Delicious

Fine recipe as is but I then started making it my own. Separately fried a pound of hamburger with taco seasoning. Added green pepper to the onion. After rice was cooked I added the ground beef, a small can of corn and a small can of diced tomatoes. Served with cheese and sour cream and nacho chips/taco shells.
Love Black Beans and Rice! I put all the ingredients in my Rice Cooker and it came out Fine! No Muss No Fuss,also used lemon ,since I had one halved.

This was great! Awesome, basic rice and beans recipe. For all the people who are whining and complaining that it didn't have enough flavor, it's the type of recipe that you can be built upon. The recipe as written, is good and simple, if you want more flavor, you can add a ton of different things to this recipe, but as written, it's very good. I topped mine with some cheese and sour cream. I'll definitely be making it again.

So easy, but to make it even simpler I chucked everything in at the front end once the rice/stock was boiling, put the lid on, and turned it off to cook the rice absorption style, then relaxed while it did it's thing. 5 mins prep, 25 mins slacking off, perfect! I added a bit of fennel and star anise and peas just to mix it up. Will definitely cook again. Singaporean Indian dinner guest loved it.
Excellent, quick and tasty!

recipe was super straightforward and easy to follow! didn't have cumin or vegetable broth so i swapped it out for adobo seasoning (w/ extra garlic powder) and chicken broth from powdered bouillon, recipe still held up & tasted great with pan-fried chicken thigh
I added a few ingredients and also cooked the rice first to cut down on cook time
I used a 1/2 white onion instead of red, I'm feeding just me and my sweetie so I cut back on everything of course. My 1st time making a black bean recipe and it was delicious!
I have made many beans/rice but this seemed to be the best. Simmering took a bit longer than 20 minutes but that could be our stove.
Loved it! Used homemade chicken stock, because that’s what I had on hand. Added fresh tomato and sour cream as garnish. Served with tortilla chips. Great lunch!

This recipe is a bit bland. I added one can of Rotel, should have added two cans for more flavor. I'll have leftovers tomorrow for lunch or maybe another dinner in a day or two & will add more spices for more flavor, depending on how the current flavors marry.

I made the recipe just as written; was in a hurry and didn't have time to read the reviews. Next time I will add the diced tomatoes and extra garlic. I also may try a bit of crumbled bacon or diced ham. It has potential, just needs a bit more flavor. Thanks for the recipe.

I used half an onion and one red bell pepper; I doubled the cumin; I added a can of Rotel fire roasted tomatoes with green chili. The Rotel really gave it a kick; you could use regular canned tomatoes for less kick. This is now going to be a staple for me!

Not quite hot enough for my preference. I would double the amount of cayenne pepper and I might add some chili powder the next time I make this. But otherwise quite good. I felt it necessary to cook the beans for a few minutes; I might add them 3 - 5 minutes before the rice finishes cooking next time.
Was really yummy. Kids loved it too
Love this! Didn’t have vegetable broth so I used water and a teaspoon (or more) of roasted garlic base flavored Better than Bouillon. It was fantastic!!!
This recipe turned out dry and a little bland. So before I served it I added olive oil, salt, pepper, tabasco, and a can of diced tomatoes.

This was delicious! I read many, many reviews and did the following~ used chicken broth, jasmine rice, +/- 2 tsp. cumin, cayenne, 1+tsp turmeric, 1 tsp garlic powder and 1/2 tsp paprika and I added a can of rotel tomatoes w chilis. I had 1 large can of black beans and a normal size (16 oz). I could have added corn too but didn't this time! These are delish!

I added a bit of cilantro and chipotle rub.
But otherwise made as written.
Did as others recommended and added corn and tomatoes. Wonderful flavor!
I thought it was a bit bland. I added some hot sauce and an extra cup of broth. The next time I make this, I will also add some green pepper.

Very bland — it needs saving but it would have been better to start by sautéing the spices with the onions and garlic to bring more of their flavor out. Adding at the end? No, no. And more garlic and salt and pepper (not cayenne) and oil are really needed to make it work. I like the suggestions others made about things they added but didn’t want this to be a tomato and chili powder kind of dish. Very disappointed.
This is a good recipe to build on. I added veggies and different spices to make it my own.

I had to add so many of the reviewers suggested ingredients and it still was a little bland. I added salsa, green peppers, corn, and more spices. It feels to me like a unfinished dish or it was meant to be served with a saucy main over it.

This was really easy to make and delicious. Every year at the Alaska State Fair I purchase a bowl of Black Beans and Rice. There was no fair this year, so I tried this recipe. It will become a regular part of our meal rotation. I added some cilantro on top at the end and served with a dollop of sour cream.

I loved it! Can only give 4 stars though because, like a degenerate, I follow the main recipe AND the top comment's suggestions. But the main recipe and the top comment's additions made for a fabulous meal. My fella said it was "spiced perfectly" and dove right in. I really liked it too. The rice ended up a little less fluffy than I'd have liked, but that's my own fault for having the additional liquid in there from the can of tomatoes. Will be sure to account for the extra liquid the next time around. Still though, soooo good! Think I've found a new staple.
This rice was a good consistency, however, it was WAY too spicy for me. My husband liked the spice though.

Made it to the recipe with the exception of only 2 cups of black beans because that's what I had on hand. Was just the right amount of heat for my tastebuds. Had it as a side with beef fajitas and a green salad. Would be a good meatless dish or maybe with some chorizo! Will definitely make again.

We’ve made this recipe several times now and it’s become a standard for us. It’s simple and excellent! A few modifications really help: we add 1/2 tsp chili powder, the spices are added when browning the rice to bring out more flavor, we substitute chicken broth for vegetable broth, we use a single can of black beans, and add some chopped cilantro at the end just before serving.

Love this as a meal or side dish. It is one of the most versatile recipes I make, not one person won't eat and doesn't love at least one version of this. Weather that's the original, with extras like corn and tomatoes, with extra spices, or another combination. I love making this extra spicy and with tomatoes and corn when it is just for me. Great as a filling for burritos as well. Goes well with the salsa chicken recipe on her too.

I liked this low-salt recipe -- I did what several had suggested -- I added a can of diced low-salt tomatoes, some frozen corn, double the cumin, and added a teaspoon of tumeric. When finished, you can garnish with tortilla strips (colored ones) or tortilla chips crumbled on top. We had chicken on the side, but we could add it to the dish as well. I sprinkled a little chlli powder on top of my portion. Nice and filling, nutritious, and good.
Very delicious. I added red and orange bell pepper and served with avacado and salsa.

This is an excellent recipe. As always, I read the reviews first, then proceed. Instead of using vegetable broth, I added 1/4 teaspoon of Lawry’s seasoned salt to the water. Once the rice was done, I added two cans of black beans (drained and rinsed) and added more garlic powder and cumin to taste. It was SENSATIONAL!
Vegan gluten free FAVORITE!! I love to take this into family events because I know I can eat something that will end safe, fill me and everyone else loves.
I ended up adding tomatoes/chili’s, corn and cut up chicken! Perfect taco or taco in a bowl! Delicious!!
I had to sub chicken broth for veg broth and chili powder for cayenne pepper and it still came out great! Love it!
Added more stock and garlic.
Excellent flavor! Everyone in the house loves this recipe! We have a 1/2 Vegan household so finding a full nutrition recipe everyone enjoys is a big win to me!
Was looking for a basic Black Bean and Rice recipe, and this fulfilled my craving.
I would definitely make his again. I added a few tablespoons of freshly squeezed lime juice. Unfortunately, I didn't have any cilantro leaves when I made it. But, I will definitely add it next time.

Used 1 can salt free black beans , 1 can mild chili, kidney beans, 1/2 c frozen corn , dash of salt, garnished with sliced green onions as pictured but not written into recipe. Very good and needs more spice next time

I never used cumin for anything besides seasoning meat and I actually made this as a side dish for my chicken cutlets and it was sooo good. Except I didn’t put any Cayenne pepper into it because my boyfriends stomach can’t handle spicy food. But wow. This is def going in my recipe book.
I added Jalapenos, Green and Red Bell peppers as well as bay leaves and cooked on the lowest setting on the crockpot.

I just made this and loved it - so delicious. I added just a little more vegetable broth (1/4 cup) and a pinch more cayenne pepper. The amount of spice was perfect with just a little bite to it. I can't wait to make it again. And, it doesn't take a lot of time to make!
I needed more stock to get the rice cooked so I added another 1/4 cup. I also added a pinch salt

This dish was a hit my family and me. I didn't have corn on hand so I simply omitted it, and used chili powder in place of cayenne pepper for the same reason. Very pleased to have another vegan recipe I can throw together in a short period of time.

Very tasty and easy! I'd give 5 stars, but didn't try it as written. As others suggested, I used 1 can black beans, 1 can corn (both drained) and 1 can Rotel tomatoes (undrained). Put 1/8 tsp cayenne & the cumin in with the rice while it cooked. Very grateful to find this recipe, since I had limited supplies and didn't want to go to the store!
Tasty and frugal. I topped it with a little salsa and shredded cheddar.
It was great! I added a can of original rotel to give it some punch and it turned out amazing

Meh. As is, this recipe does not have a lot of flavour. I added a can of corn and rotel brand tomatoes and much more seasoning. I had a super spicy salsa that I mixed in. Turned out more like a burrito bowl. Topped with cheese and sour cream!
Easy and delish! The kids liked it too...
Added turmeric, black pepper instead of cayenne, I substituted beef broth for veg broth
surprisingly filling and easy
Super yum and easy! I'll definitely make this again, great side dish or just add diced chicken, tofu or anything else! :)
Severed as a side with pork ribs. Delicious
Very good recipe. I did follow the reviewers and added spices. Will make it again.

I made the recipe as written with the exception of not adding the full amount of beans. I was combining the rice and beans and after adding one can of beans which was about 1 and 3/4 cups, I felt like that was the perfect amount of beans to rice ratio for my liking.
 Next time I will rinse the beans in water and then drain, instead of just draining the liquid from the can. When I did combine the rice and beans and stirred them together, the rice took on a dirty or gray color vs. staying white. If I would have rinsed the beans first in water, I think it would have looked prettier or more appealing.
I had no cyanine so I added a touch of cinnamon and paprika. lime, green onion, cilantro I added at the end.

Added two tomatoes, one chicken breast pre-cooked and diced, and put it on tortillas for a taco type meal. Pretty good; would recommend lime juice and cilantro if you don’t have the “cilantro tastes like soap” gene
I made this in a pressure cooker, first cooking the beans and then the rest. It was very good.

This recipe is very basic. I personally like for my food to have a lot of flavor. I added a bunch of garlic powder, onion powder, and a bunch of Cajun seasoning. I also used dry beans which I cooked fresh instead of canned beans. After all of the changes I think it was pretty good.
Added Franks red hot sauce to it, and put the beans in 7 min early. All around very good and plan on putting it in my recipe book.
Added my home made taco seasoning mix instead of the spices here and used brown rice. perfection!
I followed the recipe and used Better than Bouillon “No Chicken Base” which has the umami of chicken
I added 1/2 cup of frozen corn and topped it off with cheddar cheese. Very good!!
I added 1/2 cup of frozen corn and topped it off with cheddar cheese. Very good!!
This is a good recipe that the kids and I made. I cooked up a few steaks, chopped them into pieces and threw that in with.
Iit burned the rice into my pan. Quick frustration, making sure you have time to cook something else and not be sad.

I made this even quicker, I used my power pressure cooker. Sautéed onions, garlic and rice. Placed all of the other ingredients into the inner pot. (I used regular long grain rice) I despise instant rice. Set it on the Rice button (which is 7 min. On high. Quick release, stirred and served. It was perfect!

I followed the general recipe but used riced cauliflower instead. I also added sriracha along with lime juice, Minor's chicken base, diced tomatoes, 2 tsp cumin, red kidney beans (instead of black) and Cento tomato paste. Very yummy results. Thanks for the base recipe!
It's asparagus season so I added fresh local asparagus and defrosted fire roasted frozen corn, making a one dish meal.

Made as written, except used only a 15 oz. can of black beans, which was enough. Love the taste of cumin and it made this side dish! Served chunks of Caribbean roast pork (done in a crockpot this time) over the top of this rice and beans with thickened gravy from the meat. Oh yeah...so good!
Very Good!
I’m Haitian-American and I didn’t all these spices in the rice, I kept it simple and it still turned out good.
Good basic recipe. It needs salt at the end, at the very least.

I was shocked when my entire family loved this recipe. It was a nice flavouring. I added 1/4tsp if paprika and served more like a buffet where you can add your favourite toppings to the rice and beans. Great for a burrito bowl.
I fried up some Italian sausage, added the other ingredients and cooked in my instant pot, added the black beans at the end. Loved it!

I substituted the broth with a can of tomato soup, and it worked out fine. I doubled the garlic. Instead of a stock pot on the stove, I used my electric pressure cooker. Started on Sauté High mode and then switched to Pressure Cooker Rice mode. I let it vent naturally and afterwards stirred in the beans and spices in Keep Warm mode. An easy, versatile recipe.
This is a very tasty recipe and quickly made. One thing I would add is perhaps a little lime juice for that extra zing! My husband is a Chef and he said it was very good!

The recipe is a good one and the proportions are good but I think that the order of operations is why some people find it so bland. This is how I think the instructions should read:

1. In the stock pot, heat the oil. Set a timer for 4 minutes and dump the onions in.
2. At three minutes left, add the spices. This activates the spices.
3. At two minutes left, add the rice. I'm not at all sure that toasting rice before adding water does anything important but it seems to be the fad these days.
4. At one minute left, add the garlic. This way the garlic doesn't get murdered by cooking over direct heat for so long.
5. When the timer goes off, turn the heat down to low and add the broth. If the broth is still warm from the kettle, then it should boil instantly. Just slam that lid down to hold the steam in. Otherwise, bring up to a boil and then turn down to low and put the lid on.

Do the above and it should be pretty flavourful.
Love the taste! Simple, easy to make. Thanks for sharing!!
No cumin. Added garlic powder. 1 dash Worcestershire and Tabasco each, no cayenne. Used only 1 can beans for me. Enough for 2-3 meals. Cooked rice separately.

First time making this recipe. Very easy and delicious. Even my picky granddaughter tried it and liked it! Doubling the recipe next time as a side dish with pan roasted veggies, Italian sausages and chicken thighs. One change was that I used chicken broth.

Looked for cheap meals for big families and this... OMG I loved it!! I looked into the reviews and took from some of a couple recipes and made it mine. I have 10 ppl to feed, 8 of which are all opinionated teenagers! THEY LOVED IT! 
Heres what I did.

I added chicken which I sauted in the onion, garlic and olive oil.
To save time I used minute rice. 7 cups. Then Kroger chicken broth. 1 32 oz container and 1-14 oz can chicken broth. Then 1 can corn. 1 can red gold diced tomatoes garlic and onion. 4 cans of black beans. 

I put the chicken broth, 2 tsp paprika, 2 tsp garlic powder, 2 tsp cayenne pepper "do 1 if you only wanna a tiny twang of heat, I dont do spicy and 2 was good for me" 
put the broth & seasoning together, then add your rice to the broth. Then add beans. add the chicken with the sauted onions & garlic. add the corn and can of Tom onion and garlic. 

WAS AMAZING! When I was done warming everything together I got tortilla chips, shredded cheese & sour cream. SCORE FOR MOM!!

I made this recipe with leftover rice from a Chinese food meal a couple of days before. Probably would have tasted better with fresh rice. The cumin was a bit strong for my taste so I'll use a little less next time.

I made it and it was fantastic. Easy to make and stores and serves next day just fine, maybe even better! Lots of protein so this one is great as an entre alone or as a slightly sophisticated side.

I've used it as a burrito stuffing with some country sausage and scramble egg. Wrap it in a steamed flour tortilla. Pop it up a bit by turning some spinach into the egg and sausage mixture just before you fold in the beans & rice. Adding a little chopped cilantro (if you have it) is a great add. By now the volume has nearly double so steam a few extra tortilla shells.
Tried the review to use 2 tsp cumin & tomato’s with chilies. Way too much cumin for my taste. Plus the cayenne pepper in the original recipe made it more spice than taste
Used too much cayenne pepper but will definitely make again.
We found this really bland as written. I will try a different recipe or some of the suggested modifications if I try this again.
Was good and easy to put together
Very good. I added chopped green pepper and like it. Will make again.
No changes.....thought this was delicious and easy.
Easy to make. Outstanding flavor!
This was so yummy. I followed the recipe, but used chicken bouillon instead of veg broth. I stirred in about 1/4 cup of salsa just before serving. Will definitely make again!
